get.summary: Get the posted transactions for all cards of the account identified by the Sort Code, Account Number, Currency Code.

parameters.name: sortCode
parameters.description: The Sort Code of the customer's account.

parameters.name: accountNumber
parameters.description: The Account Number of the customer's account

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Queried transactions are on or after this date (i.e. transaction date >= fromDate). Date must be in the format of yyyy-MM-dd.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Queried transactions are on or before this date (i.e. transaction date <= toDate). Date must be in the format of yyyy-MM-dd.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: The ISO 4217 (alpha) Currency Code of account. Optional, if not provided it's ignored.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Bypasses a specified number of elements in a sequence and then returns the remaining elements.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the start of a sequence.

application/json.StatementDescription: This is an example posted transaction
This is an example posted transaction

403.description: The account is not accessible or not found

get.summary: Get the maximum number of most recent transactions of the Account identified by its Sort Code, Account Number.

parameters.name: sortCode
parameters.description: The Sort Code of the account.

parameters.name: accountNumber
parameters.description: The Account Number of the account

parameters.name: maxTransactions
parameters.description: The maximum number of transactions to return. E.g. maxTransactions=5 - the last 5 transactions of the Account are returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Bypasses a specified number of elements in a sequence and then returns the remaining elements.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the start of a sequence.

200.description: The list of most recent transactions.

post.summary:
Get the posted transactions of the listed Accounts and Cards. Accounts can be identified by Sort Code/Account Number, or their Zempler account identifier. 
Cards are identified by their Zempler Card Id.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description:
Contains the list of account and/or card identifiers. 
            Precedence order of processing the identifiers: Card Id is used, if provided. Otherwise Account Id is used. If neither Card Id nor Account Id is provided
            Sort Code and Account Number are used. If Currency Code is not provided, then it's ignored.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Queried transactions are on this date. Date must be in the format of yyyy-MM-dd and cannot exceed yesterday's date.

200.description: Posted transactions of the listed accounts/cards.

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Enti.description:
A transaction is posted to the customers account when it is debited or credited against the account. 
            Posted transactions are also called as settled, or completed, or cleared transaction.

runningBalance.description:
The balance after the transaction is carried out. 
For example, the balance is 150 and there is a debit transaction for 30. A new transaction is created
with RunningBalance 120.

settledDate.description: The date when the when the transaction has been processed in the Source system.

reasonCode.description:
The reason code of creating the (fee or balance adjustment) transaction. 
If provided by FIS, it specifies the type of the fee for which the transaction is created.
If provided by APS, it specifies the reason of creating the Balance Adjustment transaction.

transactionProcessedDateTime.description:
The date and time when the transaction was processed by the Source system(e.g.FIS).
It was nullable because CTXDATELOCAL and CTXTIMELOCAL (of which TransactionProcessedDateTime 
is composed of) was introduced only in January 2009.

cardId.description:
The internal primary key of the Card entity.
Card Id is used to identify the card with which the transaction has been made.

accountId.description:
The Zempler identifier of the Account the card (with which the transaction was created) belongs to.
This Id is used for returning results for bach queries (so that it will be obvious which account the transactions are returned to).

cardEndingIn.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

transactionCode.description: Transaction Code indicating the type of transaction. Only the code is stored, look up table can be added later, if needed.

isDebitTransaction.description: If true, the transaction is a debit transaction. Otherwise, it's a credit transaction.

transactionAmount.description: Contains information about the transactions' amount in the currency of the transaction as well as in the currency of the account.

sourceSystemInfo.description:
Information about the source system from which the transaction was loaded to LEAPS.
Having this information ensures the linkage between LEAPS and the source system.

terminalInfo.description: Information about the terminal the transaction is created on.

merchantInfo.description: Information about the merchant at which the transaction has been created.

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Valu.description: TransactionAmount value object contains information about the transactions' amount in the currency of the transaction as well as in the currency of the account.

billingAmount.description: The amount of the transaction billed (for financials) or blocked (for authorisations) to the cardholder account, expressed in the account currency.

requestedAmount.description: The value of the transaction requested by the cardholder, expressed in the currency of the transaction

conversionRate.description: The conversion rate used to calculate the billing amount from the transaction amount.

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Valu.description:
This value object stores information about the system in which the transaction has been captured, 
so that it is possible to back-link the transaction in LEAPS to the transaction captured in the source system.

sourceTransactionId.description: Unique identifier of the transaction in the Source system.

sourceTransactionLogId.description:
Identifier in the Source system to sort the transactions. 
If a transaction is consists of multiple items(e.g.the posted transaction, related fee, exchange rate), all these related transactions will have the same TransactionLogId
Applicable to network-received transactions only.

platform.description: Identifies the source system in which the transaction was captured (e.g. FIS - CORTEX, FIS - B2K)

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Valu.description: Provides information about the terminal on which the transaction has been carried out.

location.description:
Defines the site where the terminal is located. It can be a branch code or store name. 
Used as a part of the cardholder statement. Also contains description of any issuer/processor 
transactions applied to card holder accounts.

street.description: Description of the terminal location. Can be used as a part of the cardholder statement.

city.description: Can be used as a part of the cardholder statement.

countryCode.description: ISO codes. Can be used as a part of the cardholder statement.

postCode.description: Postcode of the area the terminal is located.

cardAcceptorId.description:
Card Acceptor Identifier is also known as Merchant Code. Can be used as a part of the cardholder statement.
The Card Acceptor ID is typically assigned for each store location uniquely identifying it.
Card Acceptor Id and MCC are not unique, one merchant terminal can post multiple MCCs.

latitude.description: The latitude of the geo location of the terminal.

longitude.description: The longitude of the geo location of the terminal.

category.description:
It is a category representing the transaction type that can be edited (down the line) by the customer.
For example, "Shopping".

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Valu.description: This value object stores information about the Merchant of the transaction.

categoryCode.description:
Merchant Catalogue Code, a.k.a. Card Acceptor Business Code. It's a four-digit number assigned to a business by an acquiring bank or institution when the business begins accepting Visa or MasterCard as a form of payment.
Merchant category codes have been used to classify businesses by specific market segments. For example, a veterinary clinic would be assigned a merchant category code of 0742 for "Veterinary Services."

description.description:
The description for a category code. For example, 0742 is for "Veterinary Services."
Look up in MerchantCategoryDescription table by CategoryCode.

name.description: The unique name of the platform.

transactionProcessedDateTime.description:
The date and time when the transaction was processed by the Source system(e.g.FIS).
It was nullable because CTXDATELOCAL and CTXTIMELOCAL (of which TransactionProcessedDateTime 
is composed of) was introduced only in January 2009.

cardId.description:
The internal primary key of the Card entity.
Card Id is used to identify the card with which the transaction has been made.

accountId.description:
The Zempler identifier of the Account the card (with which the transaction was created) belongs to.
This Id is used for returning results for bach queries (so that it will be obvious which account the transactions are returned to).

cardEndingIn.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

transactionCode.description: Transaction Code indicating the type of transaction. Only the code is stored, look up table can be added later, if needed.

isDebitTransaction.description: If true, the transaction is a debit transaction. Otherwise, it's a credit transaction.

transactionAmount.description: Contains information about the transactions' amount in the currency of the transaction as well as in the currency of the account.

sourceSystemInfo.description:
Information about the source system from which the transaction was loaded to LEAPS.
Having this information ensures the linkage between LEAPS and the source system.

terminalInfo.description: Information about the terminal the transaction is created on.

merchantInfo.description: Information about the merchant at which the transaction has been created.

LEAPS.Transactions.Contracts.Domain.Enti.description:
A transaction is pending when it has yet to post (clear) the customers account. These transactions may take several days to post. 
Pending transactions dont affect the Balance, but they adjust the Available Balance(Available to Spend).

transactionProcessedDateTime.description:
The date and time when the transaction was processed by the Source system(e.g.FIS).
It was nullable because CTXDATELOCAL and CTXTIMELOCAL (of which TransactionProcessedDateTime 
is composed of) was introduced only in January 2009.

cardId.description:
The internal primary key of the Card entity.
Card Id is used to identify the card with which the transaction has been made.

accountId.description:
The Zempler identifier of the Account the card (with which the transaction was created) belongs to.
This Id is used for returning results for bach queries (so that it will be obvious which account the transactions are returned to).

cardEndingIn.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

transactionCode.description: Transaction Code indicating the type of transaction. Only the code is stored, look up table can be added later, if needed.

isDebitTransaction.description: If true, the transaction is a debit transaction. Otherwise, it's a credit transaction.

transactionAmount.description: Contains information about the transactions' amount in the currency of the transaction as well as in the currency of the account.

sourceSystemInfo.description:
Information about the source system from which the transaction was loaded to LEAPS.
Having this information ensures the linkage between LEAPS and the source system.

terminalInfo.description: Information about the terminal the transaction is created on.

merchantInfo.description: Information about the merchant at which the transaction has been created.

sortCode.description: The Sort Code of the Account

accountNumber.description: The Account Number of the Account

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 Currency Code of the Account. If not provided, ignored.

accountId.description: The unique Zempler identifier of the Account. If populated, it will be used to get the transactions, regardless whether other identifiers (e.g. Sort Code, Account Number, Card Id) are provided, or not.

cardId.description: The unique Zempler identifier of the Card for which the transactions are queried. If Card Id is populated and Account Id is not, Card Id is used to get the transactions. If neither Account Id nor Card Id is provided, the Sort Code, Account Number, Currency Code are used to query the transactions.

statusCode.description:
The status code of fulfilling the transaction request for the particular account or card.
For example, 200

message.description:
Details about the outcome of fulfilling the transaction request for a particular account.
For example, 'OK'

accountId.description: The Zempler identifier of the Account the transactions are requested for

cardId.description: The Zempler identifier of the Card the transactions are requested for

sortCode.description: The Sort Code of the Account

accountNumber.description: The Account Number of the Account

scopes.accounts: Allow access to account and transaction data on behalf of the client.
scopes.payments: Allow access to payments and payment submissions data.
